newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady to lower.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Prices mostly steady to lower.

text.p: Millfeed prices were mostly steady to lower on Wednesday amid continued slow activity except for some demand for nearby supplies, dealers said.

"It is a quiet market and not much is going on," a Buffalo broker said. "We continue to see markets around Buffalo precede us on the way down." But he said the Buffalo market was steady with no change in the supply and demand scenario.
"Demand is expected to stay steady for at least three to four weeks," he said.
Several dealers noted pricing for the spot position.
"It's Wednesday, so there will be some spot orders for this week and next week," one dealer said.
A Chattanooga broker added there appeared to be some nearby truck demand for midds in the southeast.

But overall, activity was limited. "It's pretty much a flat market now through the summer," a Kansas dealer said. "We're either going to need some feed demand to show up to push the market higher, or decreases in flour mill runtimes, that kind ofthing."
